Upgrading and Replacing Rental Copiers: A Smart Move for Business Efficiency

June 23, 2025 Marga Enterprises

Is your copier slowing down your team instead of supporting them? As your business grows and your printing demands increase, your rental copier must keep up. If not, it may be time to consider upgrading and replacing rental copiers.

In this guide, we’ll explore the signs that it’s time to upgrade, the benefits of replacing your rental unit, and how to make the process smooth and cost-effective.

Why Upgrading and Replacing Rental Copiers Matters

Many businesses continue using outdated copiers because they “still work.” However, old machines can slow down productivity, increase costs, and compromise document security. With newer models offering advanced features like cloud connectivity, remote diagnostics, and eco-efficiency, the investment in a copier upgrade quickly pays off.

Signs It’s Time to Replace Your Rental Copier

Here are clear signs your current copier is holding your business back:

1. Frequent Breakdowns

If your rental copier needs servicing more often than it’s used, it’s a red flag. Frequent downtime can disrupt operations and frustrate staff.

2. Sluggish Performance

Modern copiers are much faster. If you’re waiting in line to print or dealing with paper jams daily, you're losing valuable time.

3. Outdated Technology

Can your current copier scan to email, support mobile printing, or connect to the cloud? If not, you're missing out on productivity features that streamline workflows.

4. Rising Maintenance Costs

Old copiers often come with higher repair and maintenance fees. Learn more about the cost of maintaining rental copiers and how these expenses add up over time.

Key Benefits of Upgrading Your Rental Copier

Switching to a new rental copier isn’t just about avoiding problems—it’s about unlocking new opportunities.

Improved Efficiency

Modern copiers offer faster output, higher resolution, and intelligent functions like double-sided printing and automatic document sorting. Your team works faster with fewer hassles.

Enhanced Security

New machines come with built-in data protection features, essential for safeguarding sensitive documents. This is critical for businesses handling customer records, invoices, or contracts.

Lower Operating Costs

Energy-efficient models and high-capacity toner systems reduce electricity and supply expenses. In fact, sustainable maintenance practices are easier to implement with newer models.

Smart Monitoring and Remote Diagnostics

With remote diagnostics for copiers, service teams can resolve issues faster, often before you even notice there’s a problem. This reduces downtime and keeps your operations running smoothly.

Choosing the Right Time to Upgrade

You don’t need to wait until your current contract ends to upgrade. Many copier rental providers offer mid-contract upgrades or flexible upgrade paths as part of their service. If your copier is due for retirement, speak to your provider about your options.

What to Consider When Replacing Your Rental Copier

Before switching to a new copier, consider the following:

1. Business Needs

Do you need color printing? High-volume scanning? Cloud integrations? Match the copier features to your real-world workflow.

2. User Training

Transitioning to a new machine doesn’t have to be a hassle. Make sure your provider offers staff training on copier maintenance and usage, so your team gets up to speed fast.

3. Support and Documentation

Access to manuals, online support, and user guides is critical. Check if your provider offers documentation and manuals for rental copiers for easy troubleshooting.

4. Total Cost of Ownership (TCO)

While a newer copier may have a slightly higher rental fee, it often reduces your overall printing costs due to better efficiency and fewer breakdowns. Consider TCO, not just monthly rental price.

How to Upgrade Smoothly: A Step-by-Step Guide

1. Assess Your Current Usage
Take stock of how much you print, copy, and scan each month. Look at downtime reports and maintenance logs.

2. Contact Your Provider
Ask if you’re eligible for a mid-contract upgrade or if a new model is available under your current plan.

3. Request a Demo
Don’t guess—test. A good rental provider will let you try out a new model or walk you through its capabilities.

4. Plan the Transition
Ensure minimal downtime during the switch. Coordinate installation, testing, and team training.

5. Track Performance After Upgrade
Monitor your print volume, service frequency, and supply usage after upgrading. You'll likely notice an improvement in speed, uptime, and cost savings.

Real Business Value of Upgrading Your Copier

Let’s face it—time is money. A sluggish or outdated copier costs your business more than you think. Teams wait in line, IT deals with repairs, and security risks increase. On the flip side, replacing your rental copier with a newer model improves every part of your workflow.

And because rental plans are flexible, you’re not tied to outdated technology for years. You can always upgrade as your business grows.

Final Thoughts: Keep Your Business Moving Forward

Upgrading and replacing rental copiers is more than a technical upgrade—it’s a strategic business decision. When you equip your team with the right tools, they perform better, waste less time, and focus more on what really matters: serving your clients and growing your business.

Start by evaluating your current copier’s performance. If it’s falling short, consider an upgrade. The investment is worth it—for your team’s productivity, your document security, and your bottom line.

Ready to upgrade? Speak with a rental provider today and explore smarter options that work for your business.
